intro: Morleya, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It consists of several species, primarily found in the mountainous regions of Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a range of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. Morleya species typically have hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and are adapted to grow in well-drained, rocky soils.
